47#ifndef __sockpp_stream_socket_h
48#define __sockpp_stream_socket_h
49
50#include <vector>

52#include "sockpp/socket.h"
53#include "types.h"
54
55namespace sockpp {
56
58
64class stream_socket : public socket
65{
67 using base = socket;
68
69protected:
71 friend class acceptor;
72
77 static result<socket_t> create_handle(int domain, int protocol = 0) {
78 return base::create_handle(domain, COMM_TYPE, protocol);
79 }
80
81public:
83 static constexpr int COMM_TYPE = SOCK_STREAM;
87 stream_socket() {}
93 explicit stream_socket(socket_t handle) noexcept : base(handle) {}
98 stream_socket(stream_socket&& sock) noexcept : base(std::move(sock)) {}
115 static result<stream_socket> create(int domain, int protocol = 0);
121 stream_socket& operator=(stream_socket&& rhs) {
122 base::operator=(std::move(rhs));
123 return *this;
124 }
135 stream_socket clone() const {
136 auto h = base::clone().release();
137 return stream_socket(h);
138 }
144 result<bool> nodelay() const noexcept {
145 return get_option<bool>(IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY);
146 }
152 result<> nodelay(bool on) noexcept { return set_option(IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, on); }
159 virtual result<size_t> read(void* buf, size_t n);
169 virtual result<size_t> read_n(void* buf, size_t n);
175 result<size_t> read(const std::vector<iovec>& ranges);
183 virtual result<> read_timeout(const microseconds& to);
191 template <class Rep, class Period>
192 result<> read_timeout(const duration<Rep, Period>& to) {
193 return read_timeout(std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds>(to));
194 }
201 virtual result<size_t> write(const void* buf, size_t n);
209 virtual result<size_t> write_n(const void* buf, size_t n);
217 virtual result<size_t> write(const string& s) { return write_n(s.data(), s.size()); }
223 virtual result<size_t> write(const std::vector<iovec>& ranges);
231 virtual result<> write_timeout(const microseconds& to);
239 template <class Rep, class Period>
240 result<> write_timeout(const duration<Rep, Period>& to) {
241 return write_timeout(std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds>(to));
242 }
243};
244
246
254template <typename ADDR>
255class stream_socket_tmpl : public stream_socket
256{
258 using base = stream_socket;
259
260public:
262 static constexpr sa_family_t ADDRESS_FAMILY = ADDR::ADDRESS_FAMILY;
264 using addr_t = ADDR;
266 using socket_pair = std::tuple<stream_socket_tmpl, stream_socket_tmpl>;
267
271 stream_socket_tmpl() {}
277 explicit stream_socket_tmpl(socket_t handle) : base(handle) {}
283 stream_socket_tmpl(stream_socket&& sock) : base(std::move(sock)) {}
288 stream_socket_tmpl(stream_socket_tmpl&& sock) : base(std::move(sock)) {}
294 stream_socket_tmpl& operator=(stream_socket_tmpl&& rhs) {
295 base::operator=(std::move(rhs));
296 return *this;
297 }
303 stream_socket_tmpl create(int protocol = 0) {
304 return stream_socket_tmpl(std::move(base::create(ADDRESS_FAMILY, protocol)));
305 }
318 static result<socket_pair> pair(int protocol = 0) {
319 if (auto res = base::pair(ADDRESS_FAMILY, COMM_TYPE, protocol); !res) {
320 return res.error();
321 }
322 else {
323 auto [s1, s2] = res.release();
324 return std::make_tuple<stream_socket_tmpl, stream_socket_tmpl>(
325 stream_socket_tmpl{s1.release()}, stream_socket_tmpl{s2.release()}
326 );
327 }
328 }
333 addr_t address() const { return addr_t(socket::address()); }
338 addr_t peer_address() const { return addr_t(socket::peer_address()); }
339};
340
342} // namespace sockpp
343
344#endif // __sockpp_socket_h
